Sure, here is a simplified version of the information for a GCSE OCR Classical Civilisation student:

The ancient Greeks and Romans celebrated many festivals throughout the year. These festivals were an important part of their cultural heritage and helped to bring the community together. Here are some of the most important festivals celebrated by the Greeks and Romans:

Greek Festivals:

* The Olympic Games honored Zeus and were the most important athletic event in ancient Greece. They were held every four years in Olympia.
* The Pythian Games honored Apollo and included athletic and musical competitions. They were held every four years in Delphi.
* The Eleusinian Mysteries honored Demeter and Persephone and were a secret religious ceremony for initiates. They were held every year in Eleusis.

Roman Festivals:

* Saturnalia honored Saturn and was a time of gift-giving, feasting, and role-reversals. It was held in December.
* Lupercalia honored the god Lupercus and involved the sacrifice of goats, feasting, and matchmaking. It was held in February.
* Floralia honored Flora and involved the decoration of public spaces with flowers and theatrical performances. It was held in April and May.

These festivals were an important part of the social and religious lives of the ancient Greeks and Romans and helped to bring the community together.
